channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stock Futures Slip; Investors Await Jobs Report Later This Week
item.description: U.S. stock and bond markets were closed for Labor Day.

item.title: Costco’s price increase just went into effect. Here’s how much its membership fee has gone up since the 1980s
item.description: Costco membership fees have increased to $65 a year for its Gold Star plan and $130 for its Executive plan

item.title: Markets' Summer Vacation Is Over
item.description: These charts show the tests ahead for stocks, bonds and energy.

item.title: On Warren Buffett’s 94th birthday, people share his best investing advice
item.description: Buffett has a net worth of $148 billion, making him the sixth-richest person in the world.

item.title: How to Lose Money on the World's Most Popular Investment Theme
item.description: Pity the investors in the three artificial-intelligence-themed exchange-traded funds that managed to lose money this year.

item.title: How prices for the U.S. Open’s ‘Honey Deuce’ — now $23 — stack up against inflation
item.description: Prices for the famous tennis cocktail have been raised six times since 2012.

item.title: Retail Needs Some Therapy as Cautious Consumers Trade Down
item.description: Low-income consumers are cutting back on necessities, while better-off households are looking for bargains.

item.title: I give my mother’s ailing next-door neighbor $500 a month. She agreed to sell me her house, although she’ll continue to live there. Is this a good plan?
item.description: “She has a next-door neighbor who is 72 and disabled, and has even more serious problems.”

item.title: White House Races to Lend Billions in Climate Funds Before Election
item.description: The Energy Department’s Loan Programs Office was turbocharged by the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act, but it has only used a tiny fraction of its capacit...

item.title: ‘A passenger hit me on a flight’: We argued over the armrest. If I sued the airline, would I have a case for emotional distress and negligence?
item.description: ”I complained to the flight attendant that the man hit me. He denied it.”
